paper_abstract: In the parameterized problem MAxLIN2-AA[k], we are given a system with variables x(1,)...,x(n) consisting of equations of the form Pi(i epsilon!)xi = b, where xi, b is an element of {-1, 1} and I subset of [n], each equation has a positive integral weight, and we are to decide whether it is possible to simultaneously satisfy equations of total weight at least W/2 + k, where W is the total weight of all equations and k is the parameter (it is always possible for k = 0). We show that MaxLIN2-AA[k] has a kernel with at most 0 (k(2)logk) variables and can be solved in time 2(0(klogk))(nm)(0(1)). This solves an open problem of Mahajan et al. (2006). The problem Max-gamma-LIN2-AA[k,r] is the same as MAxLIN2-AA[k] with two differences: each equation has at most r variables and r is the second parameter. We prove that MAx-r-LIN2-AA[k, r] has a kernel with at most (2k - 1)r variables. (C) 2013 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Satisfying more than half of a system of linear equations over GF(2): A multivariate approach
